quote_first: Jarrod stared at the clock on his computer. It said
quote_last: . Outside his office window it was dark. It felt as if someone had sucked all the oxygen from the room and he took an extra bath before responding.
title: All The Little Pieces
author: Jilliane Hoffman

quote_first: Above it all rose the Houses of Parliament, with the hands of the clock stopped at
quote_last: . It was difficult to believe that all that meant nothing any more, that now it was just a pretentious confection that could decay in peace.
title: The Day of the Triffids
author: John Wyndham
